New Records: The Mets are the first team in MLB history to clinch a postseason spot in a win and win a playoff series both via games in which they faced a deficit in the 9th inning or later.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead three-run homer in the top of the ninth inning.
Starling Marte added a single to make it 4-2 in the ninth inning.
The Mets trailed 2-0 in the top of the ninth inning before their comeback.
Post-Match Reflections: The late comeback shocked the Brewers faithful.
The Mets were 24-35 at one point this season but put together a fantastic final 90 games or so in order to make the postseason.
New York hasn't made the World Series since 2015, which they lost to Kansas City.
